headline.main: HEALTH: Medical Insurance; Fate of the Newest Treatments Is Often Determined by Medicare

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday ordered an independent psychiatric examination of Joyce Brown, the 40-year-old woman whose involuntary hospitalization has become a test of New York City's powers to remove disturbed homeless people from the streets.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WHEN the government of the nation's second-largest state and three highly respected health insurers are burned as New York State and Metropolitan Life, Blue Cross and Equitable have been in recent months by losses in the state's Empire health insurance plan, a lot of people start asking questions.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A surge in health insurance premiums, reflecting an unexpected failure to bring rising medical costs under control, is stunning thousands of employers and millions of workers nationwide.
